messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Punctuation question
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 1/9/03 6:43:55 AM, Earthmomma67@aol.com writes:  Do I put a
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 1/9/03 6:43:55 AM, Earthmomma67@... writes:

<< OK, good english people, After writing this:
<And I look at it like this> Do I put a comma and continuu my sentence or is
this a sentence standing alone and I put a period at the end? >>

Colon.

And I look at it like this: Whatever, whatever, whatever.

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Punctuation question

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Punctuation question
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 1/9/2003 8:43:18 AM Eastern Standard Time, ... And I look at it like this: do I use a comma and continue my sentence, or is this a sentence
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 1/9/2003 8:43:18 AM Eastern Standard Time,
Earthmomma67@... writes:


> <And I look at it like this> Do I put a comma and continuu my sentence or is
>
> this a sentence standing alone and I put a period at the end?
>
>

And I look at it like this: do I use a comma and continue my sentence, or is
this a sentence standing alone? (The "period at the end" would be redundant.)
<G>

~Kelly


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

<And I look at it like this> Do I put a comma and continuu my sentence or is
this a sentence standing alone and I put a period at the end?
